hook.text: Some orchids mimic female wasps so perfectly that male wasps try to mate with them. It works every time.

buildup.text: Ophrys orchids replicate the shape, color, texture, and even pheromone scent of specific wasp species.

discovery.text: Fooled males pick up pollen sacs during their 'mating attempt' and carry them to the next deceptive flower.

quiz.question: How do Ophrys orchids achieve pollination without offering nectar?
options: They trap insects inside their flowers until pollen transfers
They mimic female wasps so males attempt to mate and carry pollen away
